description:
On May 6, 2020, the closure of bars, clubs and discos in the communes of the sanitary cordon was confirmed even if the sanitary cordon that established them was lifted on the same date. 
 In fact, all measures applied to the communes of the cordon remained in force. Bars in the cordon were closed and remain closed until June 2, 2020.

description: As of March 17, 2020, Benin prohibits all demonstrations and all other non-essential events of a sportive, cultural, religious, political and festive nature (restriction of mass gatherings)
As of March 17, 2020, Benin recommends mourners to keep the funerals of their loved ones to a strict minimum and to postpone subsequent events

As of March 17, 2020, Benin prohibits all demonstrations and all other non-essential events of a sportive, cultural, religious, political and festive nature (restriction of mass gatherings). On May 27, 2020, the Benin government allowed churches, religious sites and bars to reopen with effect from June 2, 2020. UPDATE: On May 27, 2020, the Benin government allowed churches, religious sites and bars to reopen with effect from June 2, 2020.

On March 23,2020, Benin asks the population to not congregate on places of recreation such as beaches and festival places during the period of the Easter Holidays from March 30 to April 13 (end of the day)

On March 27, 2020, Benin announces a prohibition for more than 10 people to gather in all places except for shopping areas, which applies to the communes of Cotonou, Abomey-Calavi, Allada, Ouidah, Sèmè-Podji, Porto-Novo, Akpro-Missérété and Adjarra starting from March 30, 2020, until April 12, 2020 at midnight

On April 14, Benin announced a prohibition for more than 10 people to gather in all places except for shopping areas, which applies to the cordon sanitaire until April 27, midnight UPDATE: Benin announced a prohibition for more than 10 people to gather in all places except for shopping areas, within the cordon sanitaire, starting from March 30, 2020, until April 12, 2020 at midnight  This is extended until April 27 midnight

On May 27, 2020, the Benin government prohibits the reopening of discos, celebrations of any kind, as well as access to beaches with effect from June 2, 2020. The legislative act establishes these restrictions, while at the same time lifting the general restriction of mass gatherings.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: As of March 17, 2020, Benin makes it obligatory to respect safe distances between passengers on public transport (social distancing)

As of March 17, 2020, Benin recommends religious leaders to ensure that, during worship services, the health safety distance of at least one meter between worshipers is respected, and to avoid handshakes, hugs and all other contaminating gestures

As of March 17, 2020, Benin makes it obligatory for banks, supermarkets, bars, restaurants, businesses and other establishments open to the public to provide protective and hygienic measures and to ensure that customers and users observe the safety distance between them.
On March 23,2020, Benin asks people over 60 years of age and those with chronic conditions isolate to themselves, except in cases of force majeure

On March 27, 2020, Benin announces the obligation to respect a minimum distance of one (1) meter between people, which applies to the communes of Cotonou, Abomey-Calavi, Allada, Ouidah, Sèmè-Podji, Porto-Novo, Akpro-Missérété and Adjarra starting from March 30, 2020, until April 12, 2020 at midnight

On March 27, 2020, Benin announces the prohibition of motorcycle taxis carrying more than one person at a time, which applies to the communes of Cotonou, Abomey-Calavi, Allada, Ouidah, Sèmè-Podji, Porto-Novo, Akpro-Missérété and Adjarra from March 30, 2020, until April 12, 2020 at midnight
